posts.title: i3rbly - AI Arabic Grammar Tool
posts.text: i3rbly provides you with highly accurate grammatical analysis (I‘rāb) for any Arabic sentence, no matter how complex or difficult. This helps you verify sentence structure and understand every detail correctly.

posts.title: Spline - Collaborative 3D Design Tool
posts.text: A powerful, easy-to-use 3D design tool that runs directly in the browser. Create scenes, models, and animations, and collaborate with your team in real-time.

posts.title: Photopea - Advanced Online Photo Editor
posts.text: A free, web-based photo and graphics editor that supports PSD, XCF, Sketch, XD and CDR formats. A powerful alternative to Photoshop that runs in your browser.

posts.title: Excalidraw - Virtual Collaborative Whiteboard
posts.text: An open-source virtual whiteboard for sketching hand-drawn like diagrams. Perfect for brainstorming, planning, and visualizing ideas with a team.

posts.title: Three.js Journey - The Ultimate WebGL Course
posts.text: An extensive and highly-rated course by Bruno Simon that teaches you everything you need to know about creating stunning 3D websites with Three.js.

posts.title: SkillSwap: A Community Skill Bartering App
posts.text: An app where you can trade skills with people in your community. Trade an hour of coding for an hour of guitar lessons, no money involved. It would help build stronger local communities.

posts.title: NarrateMe: AI-Powered Bedtime Stories
posts.text: An AI that writes short, personalized stories for children where they are the main character, based on a few simple prompts like their name, favorite animal, and favorite color.

posts.title: Is full-time remote work the future, or will we return to the office?
posts.text: Let's discuss the pros and cons. What has your experience been? Is hybrid the best compromise or is one model clearly superior for productivity and well-being? I'm curious to hear everyone's thoughts.

posts.title: Design Trends: Is 'Glassmorphism' here to stay?
posts.text: We've seen the frosted glass look everywhere, from macOS to Windows 11 and countless web designs. Do you think it's a timeless trend like minimalism, or will it fade away like other fads?

disc_remote.text: I love remote work! The flexibility is unmatched. I can't imagine going back to a daily commute.
I miss the social interaction of the office. For me, hybrid is the way to go. I get the best of both worlds.
Productivity has gone way up since I went remote. No more pointless meetings or interruptions.
As a manager, it's been a challenge. It's harder to build team culture and mentor junior members without in-person interaction.

disc_glassmorphism.text: It looks cool, but can be an accessibility nightmare if not done right. Contrast ratios are super important.
I think it'll evolve. It's the next logical step after flat design, adding a sense of depth and hierarchy.
It's just a fad. In two years, we'll be back to something else. It's too visually busy for complex interfaces.
